eu.webtoolkit.jwt
Class WSubMenuItem

java.lang.Object
  eu.webtoolkit.jwt.WObject
      eu.webtoolkit.jwt.WMenuItem
          eu.webtoolkit.jwt.WSubMenuItem

public class WSubMenuItem
extends WMenuItem

A menu item that contains a nested sub menu

This class specializes menu item to have an optional sub menu.

When the item is shown and hidden when the item is selected respectively deselected.

See Also:
WMenuItem, WMenu

Method Detail

setSubMenu

public void setSubMenu(WMenu subMenu)
Set a sub menu.

Ownership of the subMenu is transferred to the item. In most cases, the sub menu would use the same contents stack as the parent menu.

The default submenu is 0, in which case the item behaves as a plain WMenuItem.

Note:A sub menu can only be set before the item is added to a menu.

getSubMenu

public WMenu getSubMenu()
Return the sub menu.

See Also:
setSubMenu(WMenu subMenu)

createItemWidget

protected WWidget createItemWidget()
Description copied from class: WMenuItem
Create the widget that represents the item.

The default implementation will simply return a WAnchor. A call to WMenuItem.createItemWidget() is immediately followed by WMenuItem.updateItemWidget(WWidget itemWidget).

If you reimplement this method, you should probably also reimplement WMenuItem.updateItemWidget(WWidget itemWidget).

Overrides:
createItemWidget in class WMenuItem

updateItemWidget

protected void updateItemWidget(WWidget itemWidget)
Description copied from class: WMenuItem
Update the widget that represents the item.

The default implementation will cast the itemWidget to a WAnchor, and set the anchor's text and destination according to WMenuItem.getText() and WMenuItem.getPathComponent().

Overrides:
updateItemWidget in class WMenuItem
See Also:
WMenuItem.createItemWidget()

renderSelected

protected void renderSelected(boolean selected)
Description copied from class: WMenuItem
Render the item as selected or unselected.

The default implementation sets the styleclass for WMenuItem.getItemWidget() to 'item' for an unselected, and 'itemselected' for a selected item.

Note that this method is called from within a stateless slot implementation, and thus should be stateless as well.

Overrides:
renderSelected in class WMenuItem

activateSignal

protected AbstractSignal activateSignal()
Description copied from class: WMenuItem
Returns the signal used to activate the item.

The default implementation will tries to cast the WMenuItem.getItemWidget() to a WInteractWidget and returns the clicked signal.

Overrides:
activateSignal in class WMenuItem
